CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 8, 1962, pg. 8, reads: "Mr. and Mrs. Lester A. White...to live in Indiana - Harris Photo." Accompanying article reads: "Speech Therapist Weds In Pretty Candlelight Rites.  Carrone Baptist Church was the setting for the Aug. 25 wedding of Jessie M. Goode, daughter of Mrs. Mary E. Goode, and Lester A. White, son of Mrs. Lula Bankhead.  The Rev. Porter W. Phillips officiated at the pretty candlelight rites.  Given in marriage by her brother, Gaddiel A. Goode, the bride wore a floor-length gown of white peau de sole, fashioned with a fitted bodice, scoop neckline trimmed with miniature pearls, and shirred elbow-length sleeves.  The fitted skirt with a wrap-around panel was bordered with pearl beads from waist to toe.  The skirt held a detachable chapel train of peau de sole caught up with a cabbage rose.  A large rose, sprinkled with pearls, held her ballarina-length [ballerina] veil of illusion, and she carried a Bible adorned with white satin streamers and ivy leaves.  Serving as maid of honor was Miss Barbara E. Ashby.  Bridesmaids were: Clara Browning, Velma Lewis and Aldora Sanders.  Charles Steel was best man, Hubert House, William R. Addison and William M. Goode were ushers.  The bride is a speech and hearing therapist for the Lake County Society for Crippled Children.  She was graduated from the University of Pittsburgh, and is a member of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority.  THe groom is employed by Inland Steel of East Chicago, Ind., where the newlyweds will reside.  Mr. White attended the University of Illinois and is a member of Kappa Alpha Osi [Psi] Fraternity."
TitMainTitle: Groom Lester A. White, and bride Jessie M. Goode White wearing gown with scoop neck, posed behind four tiered wedding cake on table with leaf patterned tablecloth and candles, another version
